description: Four quizzes testing knowledge application through multiple choice and short answer questions based on lectures, practical classes, and collaborative learning sessions. Held in weeks 3, 5, 8, and 10.

Critical analysis of research articles using molecular techniques. Students submit answers to guided questions before sessions and nominate their best attempt for final marking. Includes reflection on learning trajectory.
Recording experimental details, data analysis, and conclusions from practical classes. Graded 2-3 times with formative feedback and summative written feedback after submissions.
2-hour exam with multiple choice and short answer questions testing molecular pharmacology knowledge and application of concepts from lectures, practicals, and collaborative learning sessions.
